gurmukhi: ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਿ ਪੁਰਾਨ ਬੇਦ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਬਿਰੰਚ ਬਿਅਾਸ ਨੇਤ ਨੇਤ ਨੇਤ ਸੁਕ ਸੇਖ ਜਸ ਗਾੲਿਓ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sinmriti Puraan Bayd Saasatr Biranch Biaasa , Nayt Nayt Nayt Souk Saykh Jas Gaaiao Hai ?
translation: All the 31 Simritis, 18 Puranas, 4 Vedas, 6 Shastras, Brahma the scholar of Vedas, sage Vyas, supreme scholar Sukdev and Shesh Nag of thousand tongues sing the praises of the Lord but have not been able to fathom Him. They address Him as infinite, infinit

gurmukhi: ਸਿੳੁ ਸਨਕਾਦਿ ਨਾਰਦਾੲਿਕ ਰਖੀਸੁਰਾਦਿ ਸੁਰ ਨਰ ਨਾਥ ਜੋਗ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਮੈ ਨ ਅਾੲਿਓ ਹੈ
transliteration: Siu Sanakaadi Naaradaaik Rakheesuraadi , Sur Nar Naad Jog Dhiaan Mai N Aaiao Hai ?
translation: Shiv, four sons of Brahma, Narad and other sages, gods, men of substance, nine heads of Jogis could not perceive God in their contemplation and meditation.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰ ਤਰ ਤੀਰਥ ਗਵਨ ਪੁੰਨ ਦਾਨ ਬ੍ਰਤ ਹੋਮ ਜਗ ਭੋਗ ਨੲੀਬੇਦ ਕੈ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਓ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gir Tar Teerad Gavan Pounn Daan Brata , Hom Jag Bhog Naeebayd Kai N Paaiao Hai ?
translation: They could not realise that infinite Lord even by roaming in jungles, mountains and places of pilgrimage, making charity, fasting, doing hom-yag and offering food and other delicacies to the gods.

gurmukhi: ਅਸ ਵਡਭਾਗਿ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮਧ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਨ ਕੳੁ ਪੂਰਨਬ੍ਹਮ ਗੁਰ ਰੂਪ ਹੁੲਿ ਦਿਖਾੲਿਓ ਹੈ ॥੫੪੩॥
transliteration: As Vadabhaagi Maaiaa Madh Gursikhan Kau , Pooranabraham Gur Roop Hui Dikhaaiao Hai ?543?
translation: Such fortunate and enjoying the worldly maya are the Sikhs of the Guru who are seeing the inaccessible Lord in the manifested state of a True Guru.  (543)
